creator: eric_97@pobox.com
text:
(Actually 1.7.2, but Bugzilla doesn't know about that version).

When I hit the HTTP Proxy's "Stop" button, it creates an empty HTTP Request
element -- no name, no URL, no content in the "browser-derived headers"
subelement.

creator: eric_97@pobox.com
text:
This empty element *is* subject to filtering -- if there are any "include"
patterns, the empty element won't match them of course, and so won't be created.

To reproduce this:
  - select the HTTP Proxy
  - delete all include and exclude patterns
  - press "Start"
  - press "Stop"; the empty element will appear at this point

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
